title: How to Set White Balance Using ExpoDisc

steps.headline: Be sure to have your ExpoDisc with you whenever you are taking a photograph.
steps.description: The actual ExpoDisk has a 'leash' that you can use to keep it at hand.

steps.headline: Be sure that the light situation is what it will be when you take your photograph.
Attach, or put the ExpoDisk in front of it, the ExpoDisc to your lens.
Depending on which camera you are using, set it to where you can set the white balance.
Holding down the WB button on your camera, 'take a picture'.
steps.description: What that does is set the white balance. You now have white balance set for your exact lighting situation.

steps.headline: Shooting through the ExpoDisc, aim towards the light source(s) and shoot.
steps.description: There should be some indication of success indicated on your LED screen.

steps.headline: Take your photographs.
steps.description: Anytime that the light changes, you will need to readjust your white balance.

text: Be sure to have your ExpoDisc with you whenever you are taking a photograph. The actual ExpoDisk has a 'leash' that you can use to keep it at hand. Be sure that the light situation is what it will be when you take your photograph.  Attach, or put the ExpoDisk in front of it, the ExpoDisc to your lens.  Depending on which camera you are using, set it to where you can set the white balance.  Holding down the WB button on your camera, 'take a picture'. What that does is set the white balance. You now have white balance set for your exact lighting situation. Shooting through the ExpoDisc, aim towards the light source(s) and shoot. There should be some indication of success indicated on your LED screen. Take your photographs. Anytime that the light changes, you will need to readjust your white balance.
